MYTH: 24 million people would suddenly lose health coverage if the AHCA were to become law.   FACT: The AHCA does NOT take away coverage from a single American. It eliminates the individual mandate that forced people to purchase health insurance‚Äîwhether they wanted to or not‚Äîor face a financial penalty from the federal government. In its original report on the AHCA, the Congressional Budget Office reported that ‚Äúmost of the reductions on coverage would stem from repealing penalties associated with the individual mandate.‚Äù In other words, Americans won‚Äôt be kicked-off their plans, but rather might choose to not purchase one at all.

MYTH: The AHCA will do away with protections for those with pre-existing conditions.   FACT: The American Health Care Act protects individuals with pre-existing conditions. Period. The legislation plainly states: ‚ÄúNothing in this Act shall be construed as permitting health insurance issuers to limit access to health coverage for individuals with pre-existing conditions.‚Äù The protections for individuals with pre-existing conditions put into place under Obamacare, such as guaranteed coverage and renewability of coverage, remain the law.
Given the significant amount of misinformation targeting the American Health Care Act, it is time to set the record straight.
